credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
title: Four Allegories of Virtue, Villa Aldini, Montmorency, France
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and greyish-brown wash over black chalk on grey textured paper
description: Four octagonal drawings. Top, left: Justice shown standing on one side of niche, leaning upon fasces and raising pair of scales. Inscribed above in graphite: GIUSTIZA.  Top, right: Prudence shown standing in temple precinct, holding looking-glass and snake. Inscribed above in graphite: PRUDENZA. Bottom, left: Strength holding club and shown near trophies. Inscribed above in graphite: FORTEZZA. Bottom, right: Vigilance holding lamp with crane. Inscribed above in graphite: VIGILANZA.
name: Drawing
